articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL and JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Throughout its grinding seven-month war with Hamas, Israel has pledged to investigate a series of deadly events in which its military forces are suspected of wrongdoing. The commitment comes in the face of mounting claims — from human rights groups and the International Criminal Court 's chief prosecutor — that the country's leaders are committing war crimes in Hamas-ruled Gaza.
articles.title: The Israeli army says it investigates itself. Where do those investigations stand?

articles.author: JILL COLVIN, WILL WEISSERT and MEG KINNARD
articles.description: Donald Trump has joined the popular video-sharing app TikTok, a platform he once tried to ban while in the White House, and posted from a UFC fight two days after he became the first former president and presumptive major party nominee in U.S.
articles.title: Trump joins TikTok and calls it 'an honor.' As president he once tried to ban the video-sharing app

articles.author: EMMA BURROWS
articles.description: After his historic guilty verdict in his hush money case, Donald Trump attacked the U.S.
articles.title: Trump's attacks on US justice system after his conviction could be used by autocrats, say experts

articles.author: MEGAN JANETSKY and MARK STEVENSON
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — Mexicans went to the polls Sunday to vote for who will likely be the country's first female president, voicing concerns overwhelmingly about security, from the power of Mexico's drug cartels down to street-level stick-ups.
articles.title: Mexico votes in an election likely to choose the country’s first female president

articles.author: GERALD IMRAY
articles.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — South Africa's election has decided little, other than the African National Congress that liberated the country from apartheid in 1994 has lost its 30-year majority.
articles.title: A guide to what's next for South Africa and the key figures in unprecedented coalition talks

articles.author: BY VALERIE GONZALEZ
articles.description: McALLEN, TEXAS (AP) — At least two Texas border mayors are headed to Washington on Tuesday when President Joe Biden is expected to announce an executive order that will mark his latest and most aggressive plan to curtail the number of migrants allowed to seek asylum in the U.S.
articles.title: Border mayors heading to DC for Tuesday's immigration announcement

articles.author: TOM MURPHY
articles.description: Tamika Davis couldn’t nap on her couch during cancer treatment. She kept worrying one of her toddlers would wander over and pull out the needle delivering chemotherapy.Friends and family watched her kids when they could during her treatment last year for colon cancer.
articles.title: Being a patient is getting harder in a strained and complex US health care system

articles.author: DAVID RISING and KEN MORITSUGU
articles.description: SINGAPORE (AP) — Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accused China on Sunday of helping Russia to disrupt an upcoming Swiss-organized peace conference on the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Zelenskyy accuses China of pressuring other countries not to attend upcoming Ukraine peace talks

articles.author: COLLIN BINKLEY
articles.description: ALEXANDRIA, Va. (AP) — On one side of the classroom, students circled teacher Maria Fletcher and practiced vowel sounds. In another corner, children read together from a book. Scattered elsewhere, students sat at laptop computers and got reading help from online tutors.
articles.title: Most US students are recovering from pandemic-era setbacks, but millions are making up little ground

articles.author: DOUG FERGUSON
articles.description: LANCASTER, Pa. (AP) — Yuka Saso became a U.S. Women's Open champion for the second time Sunday and took her place in history with a rare footnote — the first Filipino to win the Women's Open in 2021, and now the first from Japan to win women's golf' biggest event.
articles.title: Yuka Saso wins another US Women's Open. This one was for Japan
